Live from NPR News in Washington I'm Jim hawk emergency workers continue searching through rubble and delivering aid and the Florida Panhandle where hurricane Michael made landfall last week NPR's Quil Lawrence reports it's still unclear how many people may have died there
Without cell phones and landlines or electricity communication between family and friends in local government has been slow in the town of Mexico beach fire chief Joseph ... is leading a search team looking for about two hundred people who had told local police they plan to stay but he's not sure they did
This storm ramped up so quickly it wouldn't surprise us if a lot of people got scared and ended up evacuating
That's his hope because looking around Mexico beach in Panama City with entire blocks of houses leveled it's hard to imagine how anyone who did stay survived and authorities fear that the death toll will rise as the search continues Quil Lawrence NPR News Miramar Beach Florida

Jordan and Syria agreed Sunday to reopen a vital border crossing between the two countries three years after the commercial linked filled a rebel groups and traffic was halted
Reopening the crossing Jordan would bring major relief to president Bashar al Assad's government by restoring much needed gateway for jury on exports to Arab countries this is NPR News
Weekend brings that talks in Brussels have ended without the hope for breakthrough on terms for Britain split with the European Union which must be completed in less than six months Teri Schultz reports the two sides were aiming to have an agreement ready for you leaders to approve a somewhat coming up later this week
A hastily called face to face meeting between the British and you negotiate it failed to break the law of gambling remaining disagreements even dancers were also called together for an unusual Sunday night meeting the early reports the deal had been reached coots falls
The British Government released a statement saying there have been real progress in a number of key areas that that arrangements for that pose threats that border between a member Ireland and Britain's Northern Ireland remain a problem to statement also said the u._k. it's still committed to making progress at an EU summit on Wednesday
That have breakfast meeting scheduled for Monday and then called off and it's not clear when negotiations will resume
For NPR News I'm Teri Schultz in Brussels
Pacific gas and electric says it will shut off power to about eighty seven thousand customers in parts of more than a dozen northern California counties utility issued a statement Sunday evening saying the move was prompted by extreme fire weather conditions and strong winds
Utilities as most customers can expect the power to be restored on Monday Night

Live from NPR News in Washington I'm Jim hawk one of the biggest losses from hurricane my goal was to deliver force base in the Florida Panhandle the base was heavily damaged and some are saying it may never be rebuilt but Florida Senator Bill Nelson is going to get the funding
It is going to be years uh in the making but this base will be rebuilt
And Ariel survey of the damage done to to know shows every building how severe damage the base remains closed down trees and power lines blocking nearly every road
Crews were backhoes and other heavy equipment scooped up splintered boards broken glass chunks of asphalt and other debris and hurricane flat and Mexico Beach Florida on Sunday the death toll from Michael's destructive march from Florida to Virginia stands at Seventeen President Trump plans to visit Florida and Georgia on Monday to see the damage

President Trump said other officials might be leaving soon asked about defense secretary Jim Mattis the president was particularly lukewarm it could
Be that he is I think he's sort of a Democrat if you want to go there to

In Germany conservatives allied with chancellor ongoing Merkel have been built a major loss after election Sunday in the state of Bavaria from Berlin NPR's psoriasis or how to Nelson reports of far right party has benefited from voter anger
It's the first time in decades that the Christian social union or see a few is losing its majority rule in Bavaria
The rhythm of the protests the link to anger over a Muslim migration to Germany German public broadcaster A. R. D. estimated a hundred and eighty thousand former seeing you voters cast ballots for the far right alternative for Germany
But not every frustrated Bavarian voter turned right the second biggest winner with a left leaning environmentalists Green Party
Didn't see it you expected to partner with that party or with the liberal free Democrats in a conservative coalition called the free voters that way to see if you can continue to govern Germany's most prosperous state psoriasis or had any now than NPR News Berlin
A flurry of talks between Britain and the European Union ended Sunday without a brags that agreement leaving the two sides just three days to close the gap in their positions before a make or break some of
The key stumbling block is resolving what to do about the border between Ireland and the u._k. Northern Ireland after Brexit [noise]
This is NPR News a federal judge in Alaska will reconsider the government's decision against listing the Pacific walrus as threatened Elizabeth Arnold reports from Anchorage
Ten years ago the federal government lifted the polar bear as a threatened species because of declining sea ice conservation groups then petition to lift the Pacific walrus for the same reason
That last year the U.S fish and Wildlife Service concluded there's not enough evidence walrus need the nights how well walrus are adapting to a warming climate is at the center of the legal battle now over their protection
Federal judges agreed to take up that question and challenge brought by the center for biological diversity
Hundreds of thousands of lovers have been coming ashore along the lack the coasts far away from where they feed in the ocean at a critical time in their breeding cycle the government's scientists haven't been able to determine yet if less sea ice has directly affected their reproductive rights for NPR News I'm Elizabeth Arnold in Anchorage
A member of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee says the U.S Saudi relationship may need to be completely revised if an investigation finds the kingdom's government responsible for the murder of Washington Post contributor ...
Republican Marco Rubio of Florida says that includes the multibillion dollar arms deal the President Trump wants to preserve
Meanwhile Saudi Arabia on Sunday and threatened to retaliate for any sanctions imposed
A warning from the world's top oil exporter came after a turbulent day on the Saudis stock exchange which plunged as much as seven percent at one point
I'm Jim hark NPR News in Washington
